result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A Gessler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[JK] cases 15CF361 and 16CF452 called at 8:49am
Defendant Travis A Gessler in court with Attorney John Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Arraignment is held on case #16CF452: Service of Information admitted; reading is waived;

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty  " entered on case #15CF361-count 1; plea of " Guilty " on case 16CF452-counts 1 and 2: factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses remaining counts
Sentencing arguments are given by Counsel.

On case #15CF361-count 1,The Court sentences Mr. Gessler to 5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years & 6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years & 6    months. This sentence is consecutive to any previously imposed sentances. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
The Court STAYS this sentence, and places Mr. Gessler on Probation for 3 years.

On case #16CF452-counts 1 and 2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years.


Conditions of Probations on both cases:

--On case 16CF452-count 1-to serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, including for conseling and including the Certified Batters Programming forthwith
---Mr. Gessler is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process. The Court authorizes that the Defendant may serve conditional jail time in the Rock County Jail or the Dane County Jail conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the Jail Term.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety; no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs; no presence in bars or taverns or liquor store
--complete a Certified Batterer Intervention Program
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or educational programming or a combination of the two as approved by the Agent
--no contact with victim unless both she and Agent consent and Mr. Gessler has sucessfully completed Certified Batterer Intervention programming. 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge
As to days credit on each case, The Court requires Counsel to either submit a stipulation on credit or request a Hearing on sentence credit within 1 week
Felony Firearm Prohibition Warnings are given.
recess: 9:18am
Status conference on February 10, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:
[JK] cases #15CF361 and #16CF452 called at 8:51am
Defendant Travis A Gessler in court, in custody with Attorney John Rhiel. DA Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Preliminary Hearing on case #16CF452:
--Attorney Rhiel submits the signed Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form to the Court.
--As the Court reviews the form with Mr. Gessler voices upset regarding lack of preparation with counsel and lack of understanding of the waiver-process.
--The Court returns the Preliminary Hearing-waiver form to the Defense and indicates the Preliminary Hearing will proceed.

-Officer Jeffrey Hensley-sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Susan Happ
--State's exhibit #1; copy of Bond form in case #15CF361-offered and received
--cross examination by Attorney Rhiel  

Counsel gives arguments regarding probable cause.
The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Gessler committed a felony. The Court binds him over for further proceedings.
The Court indicates that Bond remains fixed on both cases.
recess: 9:18am

NEXT: As to case #15CF361 -Status Conference, and as to Case #16CF452- Arraignment, both on 2/10/17 at 8:30am--send notices

Attorney Rhiel notes that case #16CF452 is still at Preliminary Hearing-stage; he requests that a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled relatively soon.

Attorney John V Rhiel in court. Defendant Travis A Gessler not in court.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel indicates that he spoke by telephone to Mr. Gessler this morning.  Mr. Gessler indicated to him that he cannot locate a friend or family member to bring him, so he is trying to raise money and arrange for transportation. 
The Court lifts the stay on the previously stayed warrant.
The Court authorizes the issuance of a body only warrant.  
recess 8:46am.

Court stays warrant until next status date of 2/12/16 at 8:30 am. Court lifted stay on 2/12/16

Case called at 2:03 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Attorney John Vernon Rhiel in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Travis A Gessler not in court. 
Atty Rhiel informs the Court that Mr. Gessler informed him that he was having difficulty obtaining transportation for today's court date. Called last week and again yesterday, but did not have a chance to talk to him today. Did not have money and was hoping for another two weeks.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Rhiel confirms that Mr. Gessler moved due to no contact provision of bond and if understand correctly, is staying with relatives. 
ADA Shock requests bench warrant; upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that Mr. Gessler has no prior criminal convictions or failures to appear
Court presents basis and reschedules status conference; Court authorizes bench warrant-Body Only and STAYS warrant until next status date of 2/12/16 at 8:30 am.
Recess: 2:09 pm

NEXT: (1) Reshedule STC 2/12/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices

case called at 1:33pm. 
Defendant Travis A Gessler appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Gessler indicates he will now be residing with his brother at:  1149 Talcott Street in Fort Atkinson WI. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at 114 1/2 E. Main Street, Watertown with the exception that Mr. Gessler may return there one time before November 6th, accompanied by a police office, to retrieve his personal belongings
--no contact with Katrina Spell
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
recess 1:37pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/2/15 at 10:00   (2) Status Conference on 1/12/16 at 9:30am
